instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.GPUVCORE_EN: What is GPUVCORE_EN? GPUVCORE_EN enables GPU VCORE when it is high, a power rail necessary for the GPU to function so you can get an image on the screen. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high. .
definitions.U8900: What is U8900? This chip creates the GPU power rails on the 820-3332 board to the 2012 and early 2013 15‚Äù Retina Macbook Pros. It becomes desoldered and is the cause of no video and kernel panics/crashes in that model most of the time..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>GPUVCORE_EN</SIGNAL> missing
threads.message:
Hello everybody

I m working on liquid damaged <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> , board is turning on, chime, usb mouse light is ok but no picture LCD. When checked voltage and heat GPU is cold and no GPU voltages, measured <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> voltages and no <SIGNAL>GPUVCORE_EN</SIGNAL>. Its come from <CHIP>U9100</CHIP> reballed and replaced also <CHIP>U9100</CHIP> but nothing change . What can i do next step?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>GPUVCORE_EN</SIGNAL> missing
threads.message: The next step should have been the first step, resolder <CHIP>U8900</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>GPUVCORE_EN</SIGNAL> missing
threads.message: Thank you [USER="2"]dukefawks[/USER]  but resolder and replaced <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> same issue

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>GPUVCORE_EN</SIGNAL> missing
threads.message: <SIGNAL>GPUVCORE_EN</SIGNAL> only comes high when GPU recognized. It also does not stay high when all power good signals don't come on in time. Could be anything around the GPU area, corrosion under it. Maybe even a dead GPU too.
